org.apache.ignite.ml.trainers.group.chain

Interface ComputationsChain<L extends HasTrainingUUID,K,V,I,O>

  • Type Parameters:
    L - Type of local context.
    K - Type of cache keys.
    V - Type of cache values.
    I - Type of input of this chain.
    O - Type of output of this chain. // TODO: IGNITE-7405 check if it is possible to integrate with EntryProcessor.
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ComputationsChain<L extends HasTrainingUUID,K,V,I,O>
    This class encapsulates convenient way for creating computations chain for distributed model training. Chain is meant in the sense that output of each non-final computation is fed as input to next computation. Chain is basically a bi-function from context and input to output, context is separated from input because input is specific to each individual step and context is something which is convenient to have access to in each of steps. Context is separated into two parts: local context and remote context. There are two kinds of computations: local and distributed. Local steps are just functions from two arguments: input and local context. Distributed steps are more sophisticated, but basically can be thought as functions of form localContext -> (function of remote context -> output), locally we fix local context and get function (function of remote context -> output) which is executed distributed. Chains are composable through 'then' method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      O process(I input, GroupTrainingContext<K,V,L> ctx)
      Process given input and GroupTrainingContext.
      default <O1> ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1> then(ComputationsChain<L,K,V,O,O1> next)
      Combine this chain with other: feed this chain as input to other, pass same context as second argument to both chains process method.
      default <O1 extends Serializable,G>
      ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1>      		 thenDistributedForEntries(DistributedEntryProcessingStep<L,K,V,G,O,O1> step)
      Add a distributed step specified by DistributedEntryProcessingStep.
      default <O1 extends Serializable,G>
      ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1>      		 thenDistributedForEntries(IgniteBiFunction<O,L,IgniteSupplier<G>> workerCtxExtractor, IgniteFunction<EntryAndContext<K,V,G>,ResultAndUpdates<O1>> worker, IgniteBiFunction<O,L,IgniteSupplier<Stream<GroupTrainerCacheKey<K>>>> ks, IgniteFunction<List<O1>,O1> reducer)
      Add a distributed step which works in the following way: 1. apply local context and input to local context extractor and keys supplier to get corresponding suppliers; 2. on each node_n 2.1. get context object. 2.2. for each entry_i e located on node_n with key_i from keys stream compute worker((context, entry_i)) and get (cachesUpdates_i, result_i). 2.3. for all i on node_n merge cacheUpdates_i and apply them. 2.4. for all i on node_n, reduce result_i into result_n. 3. get all result_n, reduce them into result and return result.
      default <O1 extends Serializable,G>
      ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1>      		 thenDistributedForKeys(DistributedKeyProcessingStep<L,K,G,O,O1> step)
      Add a distributed step specified by DistributedKeyProcessingStep.
      default <O1 extends Serializable,G>
      ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1>      		 thenDistributedForKeys(IgniteBiFunction<O,L,IgniteSupplier<G>> workerCtxExtractor, IgniteFunction<KeyAndContext<K,G>,ResultAndUpdates<O1>> worker, IgniteBiFunction<O,L,IgniteSupplier<Stream<GroupTrainerCacheKey<K>>>> keysSupplier, IgniteFunction<List<O1>,O1> reducer)
      Add a distributed step which works in the following way: 1. apply local context and input to local context extractor and keys supplier to get corresponding suppliers; 2. on each node_n 2.1. get context object. 2.2. for each key_i from keys stream such that key_i located on node_n compute worker((context, entry_i)) and get (cachesUpdates_i, result_i). 2.3. for all i on node_n merge cacheUpdates_i and apply them. 2.4. for all i on node_n, reduce result_i into result_n. 3. get all result_n, reduce them into result and return result.
      default <O1 extends Serializable>
      ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1>      		 thenDistributedForKeys(IgniteFunction<GroupTrainerCacheKey<K>,ResultAndUpdates<O1>> worker, IgniteBiFunction<O,L,IgniteSupplier<Stream<GroupTrainerCacheKey<K>>>> kf, IgniteFunction<List<O1>,O1> reducer)
      Version of 'thenDistributedForKeys' where worker does not depend on context.
      default <O1> ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1> thenLocally(IgniteBiFunction<O,L,O1> locStep)
      Add a local step to this chain.
      default ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O> thenWhile(IgniteBiPredicate<O,L> cond, ComputationsChain<L,K,V,O,O> otherChain)
      Combine this computation chain with other computation chain in the following way: 1. perform this calculations chain and get result r. 2. while 'cond(r)' is true, r = otherChain(r, context) 3. return r.

      • process

        O process(I input,
          GroupTrainingContext<K,V,L> ctx)
        Process given input and GroupTrainingContext.
        Parameters:

        ctx - GroupTrainingContext.
        Returns:
        Result of processing input and context.

      • thenDistributedForEntries

        default <O1 extends Serializable,G> ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1> thenDistributedForEntries(IgniteBiFunction<O,L,IgniteSupplier<G>> workerCtxExtractor,
                                                                                            IgniteFunction<EntryAndContext<K,V,G>,ResultAndUpdates<O1>> worker,
                                                                                            IgniteBiFunction<O,L,IgniteSupplier<Stream<GroupTrainerCacheKey<K>>>> ks,
                                                                                            IgniteFunction<List<O1>,O1> reducer)
        Add a distributed step which works in the following way: 1. apply local context and input to local context extractor and keys supplier to get corresponding suppliers; 2. on each node_n 2.1. get context object. 2.2. for each entry_i e located on node_n with key_i from keys stream compute worker((context, entry_i)) and get (cachesUpdates_i, result_i). 2.3. for all i on node_n merge cacheUpdates_i and apply them. 2.4. for all i on node_n, reduce result_i into result_n. 3. get all result_n, reduce them into result and return result.
        Type Parameters:
        O1 - Type of worker output.
        G - Type of context used by worker.
        Parameters:
        workerCtxExtractor - Extractor of context for worker.
        worker - Function computed on each entry of cache used for training. Second argument is context: common part of data which is independent from key.
        ks - Function from chain input and local context to supplier of keys for worker.
        reducer - Function used for reducing results of worker.
        Returns:
        Combination of this chain and distributed step specified by given parameters.

      • thenDistributedForKeys

        default <O1 extends Serializable,G> ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1> thenDistributedForKeys(IgniteBiFunction<O,L,IgniteSupplier<G>> workerCtxExtractor,
                                                                                         IgniteFunction<KeyAndContext<K,G>,ResultAndUpdates<O1>> worker,
                                                                                         IgniteBiFunction<O,L,IgniteSupplier<Stream<GroupTrainerCacheKey<K>>>> keysSupplier,
                                                                                         IgniteFunction<List<O1>,O1> reducer)
        Add a distributed step which works in the following way: 1. apply local context and input to local context extractor and keys supplier to get corresponding suppliers; 2. on each node_n 2.1. get context object. 2.2. for each key_i from keys stream such that key_i located on node_n compute worker((context, entry_i)) and get (cachesUpdates_i, result_i). 2.3. for all i on node_n merge cacheUpdates_i and apply them. 2.4. for all i on node_n, reduce result_i into result_n. 3. get all result_n, reduce them into result and return result.
        Type Parameters:
        O1 - Type of worker output.
        G - Type of context used by worker.
        Parameters:
        workerCtxExtractor - Extractor of context for worker.
        worker - Function computed on each entry of cache used for training. Second argument is context: common part of data which is independent from key.
        keysSupplier - Function from chain input and local context to supplier of keys for worker.
        reducer - Function used for reducing results of worker.
        Returns:
        Combination of this chain and distributed step specified by given parameters.

      • thenDistributedForEntries

        default <O1 extends Serializable,G> ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1> thenDistributedForEntries(DistributedEntryProcessingStep<L,K,V,G,O,O1> step)
        Add a distributed step specified by DistributedEntryProcessingStep.
        Type Parameters:
        O1 - Type of output of distributed step.
        G - Type of context of distributed step.
        Parameters:
        step - Distributed step.
        Returns:
        Combination of this chain and distributed step specified by input.

      • thenDistributedForKeys

        default <O1 extends Serializable> ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1> thenDistributedForKeys(IgniteFunction<GroupTrainerCacheKey<K>,ResultAndUpdates<O1>> worker,
                                                                                       IgniteBiFunction<O,L,IgniteSupplier<Stream<GroupTrainerCacheKey<K>>>> kf,
                                                                                       IgniteFunction<List<O1>,O1> reducer)
        Version of 'thenDistributedForKeys' where worker does not depend on context.
        Type Parameters:
        O1 - Type of worker output.
        Parameters:
        worker - Worker.
        kf - Function providing supplier
        reducer - Function from chain input and local context to supplier of keys for worker.
        Returns:
        Combination of this chain and distributed step specified by given parameters.

      • thenWhile

        default ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O> thenWhile(IgniteBiPredicate<O,L> cond,
                                               ComputationsChain<L,K,V,O,O> otherChain)
        Combine this computation chain with other computation chain in the following way: 1. perform this calculations chain and get result r. 2. while 'cond(r)' is true, r = otherChain(r, context) 3. return r.
        Parameters:
        cond - Condition checking if 'while' loop should continue.
        otherChain - Chain to be combined with this chain.
        Returns:
        Combination of this chain and otherChain.

      • then

        default <O1> ComputationsChain<L,K,V,I,O1> then(ComputationsChain<L,K,V,O,O1> next)
        Combine this chain with other: feed this chain as input to other, pass same context as second argument to both chains process method.
        Type Parameters:
        O1 - Type of next chain output.
        Parameters:
        next - Next chain.
        Returns:
        Combined chain.
